OptionB: Cannot be operated on ground to prevent damaging the slats.

OptionD: Is controlled manually by the pilot through the ENGI 1 and ENG 2 anti -ice pb.

Question: With the AUDIO SWITCHING knob in the CAPT ON 3 position, the Captain uses his acoustic equipment on ACP 3.
OptionA: The AUDIO SWITCHING knob must be place in ALTN position .
OptionB: No ACP 3 available for A330.
OptionD: The AUDIO SWITCHING knob must be place in STBY position.

Question: During your preliminary cockpit preparation you notice that the FLAPS lever is in the ZERO position but the E/WD shows the FLAPS extended. What should you do?
OptionA: Switch ON the YELLOW electric HYD pump and recycle the FLAPS lever.
OptionB: Do nothing. The FLAPS will move to the position selected as soon as all the engines will be started.
OptionC: You must move the FLAPS to the position corresponding to the position shown on the E/WD.
OptionD: You must check with the maintenance crew before applying hydraulic power. 7

Question: The control surfaces are electrically controlled, but are there any that have a mechanical backup?
OptionA: Yes, the THS.
OptionB: Yes, the elevators and rudder.
OptionD: No, they all required some electrical power.

Question: In Normal Law, if one side stick is rapidly pulled fully back, can the aircraft’s maximum allowable “G” load be exceeded?
OptionA: No. At maximum “G” load, the side sticks are de -activated for 5 seconds.
OptionB: Yes. Until maximum pitch attitude is reached the alpha floor protection is active.
OptionC: Yes. Rapid side stick deflection must never be made.
OptionD: No. The load factor protection overrides side stick commands to avoid excessive “G” loads.

Question: If both pilots deflect simultaneously their side sticks fully back…
OptionA: The “pitch up” order is 1.5 times higher than with only one stick deflected.
OptionB: The “pitch up” order is equal to a single stick deflection.
OptionC: No inputs are sent to the flight control computers unless one pilot presses the take over pb on his stick.
OptionD: The “pitch up” order is twice as high as with only one stick deflected.

Question: What does the NWS DISC memo on the E/WD indicate?
OptionA: There is a discrepancy between the two nose wheel steering hand wheel positions.
OptionB: A failure in the nose wheel steering system has been detected.
OptionC: The nose wheel steering has been disconnected by ground personnel.
OptionD: The nose wheel steering computer has finished its self -test. Nose wheel steering is now available. 8

Question: There are two triangles for each gear on the ECAM WHEEL page. What do they represent?
OptionA: Each triangle represents one of the braking systems available for that gear.
OptionB: Each triangle represents the position detected by one of the two LGCIUs.
OptionC: Each triangle represents one wheel on the gear .
OptionD: The front triangle indicates the position of that gear and the back triangle indicates the status of the brakes of that gear.

Question: What is the normal operating pressure in the hydraulic system?
The aircraft is on the ground and the PROBE/WINDOW HEAT is ON. All the probes are heated except for:
OptionA: Total Air Temperature (TAT) probes.
OptionB: Static ports.
OptionD: A is correct, in addition pitot heating operates at low level.

Question: With reference to the PROBE/WINDOW HEAT pb, what is the correct statement?
OptionA: The system should only be selected ON in icing conditions.
OptionB: When in AUTO mode, the windows are heated only when necessary.
OptionC: The blue light indicates that probes are heated (except TAT and windows on ground).
OptionD: Window heating comes ON automatically after the first engine start, whichever the pb position. 9

Question: Two identical FWCs generate :
OptionA: Alert messages, radio height callouts, decision height callouts, landing speed increments.
OptionB: The system display pages and Engine/Warning display pages.
OptionD: Only amber cautions and red warnings.

Question: The purpose of any of the three DMCs (Display Management Computer) is:
OptionA: Acquire data, then generate signals.
OptionB: Obtain data from the different sensors and computers and  send it to the display units (DU’s).

Question: The communications loudspeakers announce aural alerts and voice messages.
OptionA: It requires the loudspeakers to be ON.
OptionB: It requires the loudspeakers to be ON and the batteries p/b to be connected.
OptionC: It does NOT require the loudspeaker to be ON.

Question: The upper ECAM DU has failed and you want to check the DOOR/OXY page. How can you display it?
OptionA: You have to press and hold the DOOR/OXY pb on the ECP.
OptionB: You have to move the ECAM DMC selector to position 1.
OptionC: You have to press and hold the RCL pb on the ECP.
OptionD: It is not possible to see the DOOR/OXY page with this failure.

Question: Both ECAM screens have failed. Is it possible to get the E/WD indications?
OptionA: Yes, the E/WD is automatically transferred to one of the ND ’s. 10  B: No, the E/WD is lost until the FWS can be repaired.
OptionC: Yes, to get the E/WD information it must be manually transferred, using the ECAM/ND XFR on the ECAM SWITCHING panel.
OptionD: Yes, the E/WD information is automatically transferred to the F/O ’s PFD in the event of an ECAM warning.

Question: The message “CHECK EWD” indicates that:
OptionA: An EGT OVERLIMIT has been detected.
OptionB: A N1 overlimit has been detected .
OptionC: The DMC (Display Management Computer) detects a discrepancy between the parameters obtained by the DMC and the operational parameters displayed on the DU (Display unit).

Question: According to the failure “ NAV ADR DISAGREE ” select the correct answer:
OptionA: It is an independent failure.
OptionB: It is a primary failure.

Question: If the ECAM control panel fails, how can the pilot view a particular system page?
OptionA: Hold the “ALL” button down until the page of interest comes up and then release the button.
OptionB: Hold the “STS” button down until the page of interest comes up and then release the button.
OptionC: Hold the “RCL” button down until the page of interes t comes up and then release the button.
OptionD: The pilot cannot view the system.

Question: What is the speed limit for operating the windscreen wipers?
OptionA: 230 kts.

Question: Maximum demonstrated crosswind for takeoff and landing is 40 kt (gust included).
OptionA: No limitation in icing conditions.
OptionB: False.

Question: The maximum altitude with flaps and/or slats extended is:
OptionB: No limitation.

Question: The maximum altitude at which the landing gear may be extended is:
OptionA: No limitation.

Question: What is the maximum speed for landing gear hydraulic pressure supply?
The maximum speed for speedbrakes use is:
OptionA: 250 kt in clean configuration. 12  B: MMO/VMO.

Question: The minimum fuel quantity for takeoff is:
OptionA: No limitation.

Question: Takeoff at reduced thrust is permitted on contaminated runways…
OptionA: True.
OptionB: Above ISA -5ºC.

Question: Concerning the recording system, select the correct answer (aircraft on ground):
OptionA: It is active during the first 5 min after the aircraft electric network is energized.
OptionB: It is active after the first engine start and stops 5 min after the second engine shuts down.
OptionC: The crew can manually start the recording system by pressing the GND CTL pushbutton.

Question: The A 330 is equipped with ____ static pressure probes and _____ angle of attack sensors:
OptionA: 6 and 3.
OptionB: 4 and 3.

Question: IR alignment has counted down, but IRS IN ALIGN flashes in GREEN. 13  Why is it?
OptionA: Normal IRS alignment is in progress.
OptionB: IRS alignment is faulty.
OptionC: Engines are running during the IRS alignment.

Question: Concerning the BUSS (BACK UP SPEED SCALE) pushbutton, select the correct answer:
OptionA: Once it is pushed, it is irreversible.
OptionB: Each pb independently commands the display of the BUSS on its associated side.
OptionC: The BKUP SPD/ALT information is displayed only if flight level is below 250.
OptionD: The BUSS information is based on the IRS.

Question: The flight crew can use the BUSS (BACK UP SPEED SCALE):
OptionA: Above FL250.
OptionB: Below FL250.

Question: The data received from the GPS:
OptionA: Overrides the information supplied by ADIRS.
OptionB: Is transferred to the ADIRU.
OptionC: Once the ADIRU has the data, it performs the GPS -IRS hybrid position calculation which is used by the FMGEC.

Question: The BACKUP CONTROL MODULE (BCM):
OptionA: The BCM will grant direct RUDDER command with pedals.
OptionB: The BCM provides yaw damping.
OptionC: Is an independent unit with its own generator.

Question: Flashing RELIEF message is displayed when:
OptionA: The FLRS (Flap Load Relief System) has retracted the flaps to the next retracted lever position because VFE has been exceeded.
OptionB: If speed is reduced below VFR -2.5 kt flaps return to their normal (selected) position.
OptionC: A is correct and FLRS is available whenever the Flap/Slats lever is position 2, 3 or FULL.

Question: In case of a double FWC failure, MASTER CAUTION light, aural warnings and ECAM cautions and warnings are lost.
OptionA: False.
OptionB: ECAM cautions and warnings are never lost.
OptionC: MASTER CAUTION light is still available.

Question: If HDG/TRK is engaged, the guidance does not consider any F - PLN constrain. Therefore if the pilot disengage NAV, CLB mode reverts to OP CLB.
OptionA: Only in DIRECT LAW.
OptionB: True.

Question: Pushing DITCHING pb cuts off _______.
OptionA: The outflow valves, the emergency RAM AIR inlet, the avionics ventilation inlet and extract valves, and the pack flow control valves.
OptionB: The outflow valves and the emergency RAM AIR inlet.
OptionC: The outflow valves and the pack flow control valves.

Question: The flight guidance function is _____.
OptionA: AP, Flight Plan, Auto Thrust.
OptionB: AP, Performance, Auto Thrust.
OptionC: AP, Flight Director , Auto Thrust. 15  D: AP, Flight Management, Auto Thrust.

Question: If all main generators fail, EMER GEN is inoperative during flight. The static converter supplies _____.
OptionA: AC ESS.
OptionB: AC 1 and AC 2.

Question: If there is an imbalance between the left and right wing tanks by more than ______, the quantity display pulses in the inner and outer tanks.
On the ground, the Aft APU pump provides fuel from the trim pipe for the first minute(s)  ______ of APU operation.
OptionA: One.
OptionB: Two.

Question: In normal operation, automatic CG control
OptionA: Begins during climb to FL245, ends at descent to FL 255 or when FMGC time to destination is less than 35 minutes.
OptionB: Begins during climb to FL255, ends at descent to FL 245 or when FMGC time to destination is less than 35 minutes.
OptionC: Begins during climb to FL255, ends at descent to FL 245 or when FMGC time to the destination  is less than 75 minutes.
OptionD: Begins during climb to FL245, ends at decent to FL 255 or when FMGC time 16       to the destination  is less than 75 minutes.

Question: If fuel tank pump pb set on OFF position, the fault light:
OptionA: Is inhibited.
OptionB: Comes on when the delivery pressure drops.

Question: The maximum fuel quantity for A330 -300 is:
OptionA: About 70500 kg.
OptionB: About 109000 kg.

Question: When the jettison system is damping fuel in flight:
OptionA: Output rate is approximately 1000kg per minute excluding fuel burn.
OptionB: Output rate is approximately 3000kg per minute excluding fuel burn.
OptionC: Output rate is approximately 500kg per minute excluding fuel burn.
OptionD: Output rate is approximately 1000kg per hour excluding fuel burn.

Question: The flight mode changes to flare mode, when A/C descents passing:
OptionA: 50 ft.
OptionB: 75 ft.

Question: In normal operation, the trimmable  horizontal stabilizer:
OptionA: Is driven by one of the three electrical motors.
OptionB: Is driven by three electrical motors.
OptionC: Is driven by the first of the two electrical motors.
OptionD: Is driven by the two of the three electrical motors. 17

Question: In normal operation, the elevator and stabilizer is controlled by:
OptionA: PRIM1 .
OptionB: PRIM2 .

Question: In the normal rudder electrical control:
OptionA: PRIM1 controls blue hydraulic jack, PRIM2 controls green hydraulic jack, PRIM3 controls the yellow  hydraulic jack .
OptionB: PRIM1 controls yellow hydraulic jack, PRIM2 controls green hydraulic jack, PRIM3 controls blue hydraulic jack.
OptionC: PRIM1 controls green hydraulic jack, PRIM2 controls blue hydraulic jack, PRIM3 controls the yellow hydraulic jack.

Question: What is the purpose of LAND RECOVERY pb?
OptionA: To release RAT manually.
OptionB: To inhibit RAT, extend slats for landing.
OptionC: It is the necessary system to recover approach and landing.
OptionD: Let ILS and slats and flaps connect to APU BAT for landing.

Question: In flight the left seat captain pushes the takeover pb and maintains and the right seat first officer pushes  the sidestick unintentionally. What will happen?
OptionA: The priority green light of both sides illuminates  the arrow red light illuminates on the right side.
OptionB: The priority green light on the left side illuminates, the arrow red light illuminates on the right side.
OptionC: The priority red arrow light of left side illuminates, the priority green light 18        illuminates on the right side.

Question: A/C is turning with 45º bank angle. What will happen if the pilot releases the sidestick?
OptionA: The bank angle maintains 45 º.
OptionB: The bank angle automatically reduces to 33º.
OptionC: The bank angle automatically reduces to 25 º.
OptionD: The bank angle automatically reduces to 0.

Question: Which two hydraulic systems are there driving slats?
OptionA: Green and Yellow.
OptionB: Green and Blue.

Question: In normal operation, the data for ADIRU aligning is from.
OptionA: ADIRU CDU .
OptionB: ACMS .

Question: Normally, GPS1 receiver provide information to:
OptionA: ADIRU1.
OptionB: ADIRU1 and ADIRU2.

Question: “TCAS REDUCE RANGE” displayed on ND when:
OptionA: TA or RA is detected, and the ND range is above 10 NM.
OptionB: TA is detected, and the ND range is above 20 NM .
OptionC: TA or RA is detected, and the ND range is above 40 NM.
OptionD: RA is detected, and the ND range is above 10 NM.

Question: The aural alert for excessively rate of decent warning is: 19  A: Sink rate - Pull up.
OptionB: Terrain.

Question: How many weather radars are installed in the aircraft?
OptionA: One.
OptionB: Two.

Question: G P W S  a u r a l  a l e r t  “ D O N ' T  S I N K ”  s o u n d e d  w h e n  i s d e t e c t e d .
OptionA: Excessive deviation below glide slope.
OptionB: Altitude loss after take -off.

Question: Wind shear alert is inhibited:
OptionA: At takeoff above 100kt and up to 50ft.
OptionB: At takeoff from 80kt till lift off 5 seconds and during landing below 100ft.

Question: During your preliminary checks you set the ADIRS to align. The ON BAT light comes on. Why is this?
OptionA: It is a reminder that the alignment is carried out using battery power.
OptionB: Comes on for a few seconds to test the battery circuit.
OptionC: It is a reminder that it is necessary to turn on the aircraft batteries.
OptionD: It is an indication that there is a fault with the battery circuit.

Question: Pressurization control is fully automatic, consists of two 20  outflow valves:
OptionA: Each valve has 2 motors (1 automatic,1 manual).
OptionB: E a c h  v a l v e  h a s  3  m o t o r s  ( 2  a u t o m a t i c , 1  m a n u a l ) .
OptionC: Each valve has 3 motors (1 automatic,2 manual).

Question: What appears on ECAM CAB PRESS page when cab alt between 8800ft and 9550ft?
OptionA: The digital presentation pulses.
OptionB: The analog and digital presentations appear in amber.
OptionC: The analog and digital presentations appear in red.

Question: The MAX. NORM. CABIN ALT. is:
Temperature regulation is controlled by:
OptionA: One zone controller .
OptionB: One zone controller and two pack controllers.
OptionD: Two zone controllers and two pack controllers.

Question: On which page of ECAM can you monitor the position of outflow valve?
OptionA: AIR COND.
OptionB: BLEED.

Question: If LDG ELEV is set to AUTO, the LDG ELEV data sends to controller from:
OptionA: FCU.
OptionB: ADIRS.

Question: The TRIM AIR valves:
OptionA: Optimize the zone temperature by adding cold air.
OptionB: Optimize the zone temperature by adding hot air.
OptionC: Optimize the zone temperature by adjusting hot air pressure.

Question: The maximum altitude with flaps and/or slats extended is:
The minimum engine oil pressure of the RR engine is:
OptionA: 40 psi.
OptionB: 20 psi.

Question: How many pumps are there in each wing tank?
OptionA: Three pumps in each wing tank.
OptionB: There are no fuel pumps, since fuel tank is air pressurized.
OptionC: One pump in each wing tank.
OptionD: Two pumps are shared by all fuel tanks. 22

Question: Maximum speed for landing gravity extension and maximum tyre speed  respectively are:
OptionA: 200kt and 204kt .
OptionB: 204kt and 205kt.

Question: The maximum cabin positive differential pressure is:
How is standby engine data displayed?
OptionA: On the pilot side ND.
OptionB: On the F/O side ND.
OptionC: On either ND after placing EFIS control knob to the ENG position.
OptionD: On either ND after placing EFIS control knob to the STD BY position.

Question: The RR TRENT -700 engine is a :
OptionA: Single -rotor high bypass ratio turbofan engine.
OptionB: Dual -rotor high bypass ratio turbofan engine.
OptionC: Triple -rotor high bypass ratio turbofan engine.
OptionD: Triple -rotor high bypass ratio turbojet engine. 23

Question: During automatic start on the ground, start valve closes when:
OptionA: N3 is above 50% with N3 between 25% and 30% ignition occurs and HP fuel valve open .
OptionB: N3 is above 50% with N3 above 30% ignition occurs and 40% HP fuel valve open.
OptionC: N3 is above 50% with N3 above 40% ignition occurs and HP fuel valve Open.
OptionD: Mode selector is set to NORM with N3 above 25% ignition occurs and 40% HP fuel valve open.

Question: The reverser is actuated by:
OptionA: Hydraulic actuators: green for engine 1, yellow for engine 2.
OptionB: Hydraulic actuators: blue for both engines.
OptionC: Hydraulic actuators: blue for engine 1, yellow for engine 2.

Question: Which of the statement about FADEC system is correct?
OptionA: FADEC has two -channel redundancy, with one channel active and one in standby.
OptionB: FADEC has two -channel redundancy and the two -channel working synchronously.
